com.cyc.query

Interface QueryAnswer


  • public interface QueryAnswer
    Encodes one answer to a Query.

    Unlike InferenceAnswer, this class is designed to use KB API classes, so variables are Variables, and bindings are returned as KbObjects where possible.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T getBinding(Variable var)
      Get the value to which the specified variable is bound.
      Map<Variable,Object> getBindings()
      Get the values to which the all variables are bound.
      InferenceAnswerIdentifier getId()
      Get the identifier for this answer.
      Set<KbTerm> getSources()
      Get the attributed sources used in inferring this answer.

    • Method Detail

      • getBinding

        <T> T getBinding(Variable var)
        Get the value to which the specified variable is bound.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The expected class of the value.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable for which the binding is sought.
        Returns:
        The value to which var is bound in this answer.

      • getBindings

        Map<Variable,Object> getBindings()
        Get the values to which the all variables are bound.
        Returns:
        A mapping from variables to the values to which they are bound in this answer.

      • getId

        InferenceAnswerIdentifier getId()
        Get the identifier for this answer. This can be used to unambiguously identify this answer to the Cyc that produced it, so long as the inference has not been destroyed.
        Returns:
        the identifier.

      • getSources

        Set<KbTerm> getSources()
        Get the attributed sources used in inferring this answer. Generally, results will include SKSI sources, or terms used in meta-assertions using sourceOfTerm-NonTrivial or its specializations. Note that this method works by introspecting on the inference object, and will not work if the inference has already been destroyed when this is called. The canonical way of ensuring that the inference is not destroyed immediately is to call Query.retainInference(), though there are other ways of ensuring the inference is not immediately destroyed, such as InferenceParameterSetter.setBrowsable(boolean) and InferenceParameterSetter.setContinuable(boolean).
        Returns:
        A set of KbTerms that are the attributed sources for this answer.
